definition: to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)

sentences.english: A laser phase modulation system with acoustooptic modulator is described.
sentences.chinese: 本文叙述了一种包含有声光调制器的激光调相系统。

sentences.english: Discussion on unit phase modulation pressing water system and test of Tuyen Quang hydroelectric project in …
sentences.chinese: 越南宣光水电站机组压水调相系统及其试验浅析。

sentences.english: The demodulation technique of PRCPM fuze signal is studied.
sentences.chinese: 研究了伪码调相引信信号的解调技术。

sentences.english: Warm tone papers usually produce the most visible effects.
sentences.chinese: 暖调相纸的变化通常很大。

definition: harmonious/to adjust/to tune (e.g. wireless receiver)/to bring into harmony
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
harmonic (wave with frequency an integer multiple of the fundamental)
filtering radio waves (i.e. to pick out one frequency)
